Class FinalProgram

  • java.lang.Object
    • FinalProgram

  • public class FinalProgram
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the final console program that simulates the functions of YELP. It allows queries through the command line and outputs the desired results. If the queries are wrong, the program outputs the appropriate error message.
    Author:
    Ivan Evtimov

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) Database data
      This field is the database that stores all the data.
      (package private) java.util.Scanner userInputScanner
      This field is the scanner for the user's input.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FinalProgram(java.lang.String inputFilePath)
      The constructor of the program initializes the data field and creates the database from the specified file (a file path as a string).

    • Field Detail

      • data

        Database data
        This field is the database that stores all the data.

      • userInputScanner

        java.util.Scanner userInputScanner
        This field is the scanner for the user's input.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FinalProgram

        public FinalProgram(java.lang.String inputFilePath)
        The constructor of the program initializes the data field and creates the database from the specified file (a file path as a string). If an exception for the format of the input database is thrown, the program will terminate there and print out an error message.
        Parameters:
        inputFilePath - the path to the restaurants.txt file

    • Method Detail

      • search

        public java.util.ArrayList<Restaurant> search(java.lang.String inputString)
        This method is designed to ask the user for a city, category, cost and time and perform the search based on the user's input.
        Parameters:
        inputString - the list of user parameters in a string, separated by a semicolong
        Returns:
        the output of the search in the database.

      • printSearchResult

        public void printSearchResult(java.util.ArrayList<Restaurant> searchOutput)
        This method is designed to print out the result of the search given the array that the search method in the Database class returns.
        Parameters:
        searchOutput - the output of the search method (an arrayList)

      • review

        public void review(java.lang.String inputString)
        This method adds a review from the user's input. Again, this method is designed to be used in conjunction with the scanInForReview() method, which returns a string with the user's parametres separated by semicolons.
        Parameters:
        inputString - the input string of the user's parameters separated by a semicolon

      • scanInForReview

        public java.lang.String scanInForReview()
        This method scans in the user input for review
        Returns:
        the string with the user input, separare parametrs separed by semicolong

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String inputString)
        This method handles the add command based on the user's parameters. It is designed to be used in conjunction with the scanInForAdd method, which returns the user's parameters separated by semicolons.
        Parameters:
        inputString - the user's parameters for the add, separated by semicolons

      • scanInForAdd

        public java.lang.String scanInForAdd()
        This method performs the scan of user commands necessary for the add method.
        Returns:
        a string of the user's parameters, separated by a semicolon

      • quit

        public void quit()
        This takes care of the quit command. It uses a BufferedWriter to write to the output file and then

      • identifyCommand

        public void identifyCommand(java.lang.String userInput)
        This method is designed to identify the command that the user has given and call the appropriate method.

      • scanCommand

        public java.lang.String scanCommand()
        This method scans the user's next command.
        Returns:
        the next command of the user.

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        This method checks if the quit method has been called.
        Returns:
        true if the quit method hasn't been called, false otherwise

      • scanInForSearch

        public java.lang.String scanInForSearch()
        Method to read in the data for the search.
        Returns:
        a string with the user's parameter inputs, separated by a semicolong

      • close

        public void close()
        This method closes the user input scanner.
